summary: Email chain between U.S. Department of Justice prosecutors regarding information forwarded from Norwegian authorities about Jeffrey Epstein's donations to the International Peace Institute in New York. The information originated from a woman who provided it to the Norwegian Ministry of Foreign Affairs.

persons.name: Hilde Stoltenberg
persons.role: Liaison Prosecutor for Norway at Eurojust
persons.context: Norwegian prosecutor who forwarded information about Epstein's donations to the International Peace Institute to U.S. authorities via Eurojust channels.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Subject of the investigation, mentioned regarding donations made to the International Peace Institute in New York.

connections.description: Stoltenberg forwarded information about Epstein's financial activities to U.S. authorities as part of international cooperation.

events.title: Norwegian information forwarded about Epstein donations
events.description: Hilde Stoltenberg sent information from the Norwegian Director of Public Prosecutions regarding Jeffrey Epstein's donations to the International Peace Institute in New York.

events.title: U.S. prosecutors acknowledge receipt of Norwegian information
events.description: Assistant U.S. Attorney in Southern District of New York confirms receipt of information about Epstein's donations forwarded through Eurojust channels.

keyFacts: Norwegian authorities provided information about Jeffrey Epstein's donations to the International Peace Institute in New York.
The information was forwarded through Eurojust, the EU's judicial cooperation unit, indicating international coordination in the Epstein investigation.
A woman provided the information to the Norwegian Ministry of Foreign Affairs, with her identity available upon request to U.S. authorities.
The U.S. Department of Justice Office of International Affairs was involved in receiving and processing the information.
The correspondence shows international law enforcement cooperation between Norway, Eurojust, and U.S. prosecutors in the Southern District of New York.
